description.raw:
Recently, we had an issue where a change to one of `node-gyp`'s dependencies broke the deploy/installation of gzweb. Officially, the fix is to lock node-gyp to a previous version of that dependency. See here:

[https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/issues/1299](https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/issues/1299)  
 [https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/pull/1300](https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/pull/1300)

...but that fix isn't merged/released yet. Adding an `npm-shrinkwrap.json` file to this package will solve that problem by specifying the right dependency at gzweb's level. npm-shrinkwrap is automatically parsed and handled by `npm install`, with no additional plumbing needed.

More broadly, this will lock all dependencies to known-working versions, so that such upstream breakages won't affect gzweb in the future. I've only tested this against 1.3.0, but it may be a good idea to add such a file to all branches, particularly all "old" branches which have fallen out of regular use/testing.

https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/pull/1300

More broadly, this will lock all dependencies to known-working versions, so that such upstream breakages won't affect gzweb in the future. I've only tested this against 1.3.0, but it may be a good idea to add such a file to all branches, particularly all "old" branches which have fallen out of regular use/testing.

title.raw: Added npm-shrinkwrap to lock versions of upstream node packages
